1.content:
You wake up in a forgiving straw bed with your head throbbing. Light dances in through the cracks in the walls, of which there are plenty. You lie in a old, quaint shack somewhere near the beach (the sounds of the rolling tide are a dead giveaway.) You can hear footsteps approaching, but you are too slow to feign sleep.

"Rested yet?" asks a cheery Gargomon. "You've been out cold for over a day."

"Uh..."

"You hit your head pretty hard back there. Do you remember anything?"
1.title: Wakeup call

11.content:
"Okay, assuming you really were human to begin with, you were changed into a Veemon."

You throw up the bedsheets to see that, in fact, you are a Veemon.

"So anyways, you rescued me from Bing's Tickle Mansion, I made an ass of myself, and you sacrificed yourself to bail me out again."

"Sacrificed myself? Is that why my head hurts?"

"No, that was from hitting your head on the way here. Back there, you were tickle tortured by a nasty little Impmon. Anyways, we left for here, I met a couple of my friends along the way, and we spent the night with them. It was afterwards that you hit your head."

"Oh" is all you can say, overwhelmed by the situation.

"You want to give me a hand with these?" Gargomon flips a net full of fish over his shoulder.

"What'cha want me to do with em?" Fully rested, you have no problem sprining out of bed.

"Just follow me. By the way, do you even remember my name?"
11.title: Crash course in current events

choices: Now that you mention it, I don't know
112.content:
"Glenn, right?"

"Well, that's a good start."

You follow Glenn from the seaside shack around the corner to a smaller, conjoined shack. A large wooden shelf exends from the side of the shack, onto which Glenn throws the sack of fish. The door is opened long enough for Glenn to drag out a large tub and a couple of knives. He shows you how to de-scale and clean a fish out. Then, he pats each down with some 'curing spice' from the tub and throws it on a rack. By the time you've prepared seven fish, Glenn has finished off the remaining fourty.

"So, are you a fisherman, or does everyone you know clean a fish like that?"

"I'm one of the few. The rest of us fishers are scattered around the shore. My strip starts fifty yards to the right and goes out to the left as far as I want it to. The Oxys are all over the place, but they help us fishers out by fighting off some of the larger critters out there." Glenn hoists the rack into the smoker and rests a finished rack on the shelf you were just using. He helps himself to some and offers it to you as well. Naturally, its perfectly smoked.

You turn your gaze to the lapping ocean and you realize just how foreign it all looks. "Where are we?" you think to ask.

"Alcrux. Its an all-bunny town."

"We're not in Kansas anymore," you quietly muse.

"Where's Kansas?"

"Never heard of Kansas?" A simple shake of the head and a look of bewilderment are all the answers you need. "It's right in the middle of America."

"Well, where is that?"

Well, the ocean didn't look that foreign.

"It's back where I'm from, which is apparently a long ways away."

"Well, there must be some way to get back there. I assume you want to get back home sooner or later, right?"
112.title: Finding solid ground

choices: "What do you know about the mansion?"
1121.content:
"Of course I do!" As nice as it is here, you can't say forever.

"Understandable. You should ask Plazo about that. That bunny's a few fish short of an ocean, but he has a lot of experience with that crazy kind of stuff. Probably why he's so nuts now. Let me just pack up this fish and we can head into town."

Glenn diligently packs up the rack of fish into a pair of wicker baskets, which he slings over his shoulders. "Come on, now" he becons.

The path uphill from the beach is steep. This beach is much wider than the thin strip you traveled up to reach Glenn's house in the first place. You keep loosing your footholds and sliding back in the sand. Nevertheless, the silence asks to be broken.
1121.title: The first step on the long way home

choices: Actually, I would rather have a look around here first
11212.content:
"Bing's place? For starters, its been like that for less than a decade. Originally, it was like a resort. People from all over would come to stay the weekend, and there was always a bunch of tickling going on. Gauss and I used to save up and go there every couple of months for a few days."

"A friend of yours?"

"My brother. I was up there trying to bail him out of there, but they captured me instead."

"Damn. What happened to the place?"

"I honestly don't know. Most of the people think that Bing went rotten, but I don't buy it. He was a nice enough guy; even tickled eachother once or twice."

"Then what happened?"

"I heard that he left in the middle of a power struggle when someone tried to make a real business out of it."

"Hey Glenn" says a brown hare from under his straw hat. His shady stand faces away from the beach and apparently sells nothing but foodstuffs.

"Hey Pan" groans Glenn as he heaves the baskets onto the counter. "How's life?"

"Same old, same old. Who's the blue guy?"

"Just a friend of mine," responds Glenn casually.

"Whatever you say, chief." Pan rummages under the counter to find a small pouch, presumably full of coin, which he throws to Glenn. "Take it easy, aiight?"

"You too," says Glenn, who pockets the pouch and keeps moving.

Finally, the town comes into view. It's mostly a two-story town made entirely of wood with broad alleyways. Everyone in sight is a bunny, and there is no shortage of them. Big fat ones who shake with laughter, little grey ones who trip over eachother playing games in the street, and spindly brown ones peddling their wares.

"You want to go talk to Plazo?"
11212.title: About the mansion

choices: Isn't there someone else we could talk with?
112121.content:
"That's why we're here, isn't it?"

"And so I can buy ammo, but that can wait."

Glenn, being one of the bigger bunnies around, has little trouble getting through the crowd. You find it easiest to walk in his wake. You almost walk into him when he slows down to talk with someone. He speeds back up and suddenly turns into an alleyway. The slowdown has stuck you behind several bunnnies and you are afraid you'll lose him. So, you turn sideways and try to wiggle your way through the crowd. Nearly falling into the alleyway, you are relieved to see that Glenn has waited for you.

"Alright, hop on" he sighs and lowers a shoulder. Instead of sitting on his shoulder, you sling a leg over so that you are straddling his neck with his ears going over your legs. When he stands up, you can feel his ears pushing down on your legs.

"How strong are those things?"

"What things?"

"Your ears. I mean, are they strong enough to use as another pair of arms or anything?"

"They're almost as strong as my real arms. I just never use them because they're so much harder to control. Just imagine moving your arms if they had no bones." Not being too fond of the idea, you drop the subject.

Finally, after taking several more shortcuts through the swarming crowd, you reach a calm bubble surrounding a dilapidated shack. It is questionable if the sign ever was legible, although it certainly is not currently. An angry crow perches on the sign, screaming at you in the only voice it can. The weight of the shack had slouched against another, sturdier building, and you are cautious to enter the building in the first place.

"Just make sure you don't affend him. He's a scary looking guy, that's for sure, but he is the chief's brother. In fact, the chief is usually the only one who takes him seriously. When in doubt, just agree with him."

"Alright," you choke out, although the lump in your throat brings it down to a whisper.
112121.title: To Plazo

choices: I just want to be human again
1121212.content:
Glenn, once again, leads the way. His broad paw falls on the first step, and the entire shack groans in agony. You follow him into the ancient shack. The light quickly dwindles; only the whispy, pale block of light behind you remains.

"Glen? The shit you do'n here?" A growl of a voice smacks you upside the head before you can see a thing. "An who else is with you thur?"

Glenn moves out of the way to reveal what appears to be a saloon. A musty bar stands in front of you, as well as countless destroyed chairs. Flames float in the air without any rhyme or reason. Above the bar hangs an enormous and ornate dreamcatcher, devoid of any apparent dust or cobwebs.

"Just a friend of mine. We came here because he"

"Used to be a human, right? There's too much junk in his mind for him to be anything else."

Amazed by the offhand comment, you totally ignore the included insult. "Well, yeah."

"Damn straight you were! Hop up here."

You approach the bar and hoist yourself onto one of the few remaining stools. Behind the counter stands a ghastly figure. What used to be a snow-white rabbit has decayed into a grey, shedding figure. His eyes are glazed over: he's probably blind. All sorts of talismans hang from the ancient creature. His short, grizzly ears still bother to stick straight up.

"Name's Plazzo, kid. You want som'm drink?"

"Uh, nice to meet you, sir." Eyeing the dusty bottles behind him, you decide to forgo the drink.

"Bullshit it is! You would'n be here if you didn'n have a problem, so I know its not 'nice to meet me'. And your havin a damn drink, kiddo. Pick yer poison."

Taken aback, you try to get on Plazzo's good side. "Surprise me."

"That means you don' know whats-a goin on right about know. All fuzzy in the head, ya know? You got a pair right now, Glenn?"

"Do your worst, old man."

"An I will!" The grizzled rabbit whips out a pair of highball glasses from under the counter and a pair of amber bottles from behind him. He uncorks each with his thumb and sloshes them over the top of both glasses. "This shi'll make ya see stars. Bottoms up, boys!"

You grab your glass by the edges and sip precariously. It hits you like a punch in the face. In the middle of your drinking, Plazo begins to talk.

"So, watcha itchin to do first, gettin outta that digi-body or gettin the hell out of Alcrux?"
1121212.title: The Village Elder?

11212122.content:
"Well, I really just want to get back home, but not in this body."

"You don' ask fer much, do ya?" Plazo laughs dryly and pounds the rest of the bottle as if it was water. "Well, that's easy eno'f!"

You perk up and slide to the edge of your stool. "What do I have to do?"

"Get back in the masion! Ya gotta get on back to the main entryway, find yourself in the 'banks, have someone switch ya back out, and get out through the jumper."

"Well, how do I do that?"

"Beats the hell outta me, kiddo! That place is swarmin with garbage."

"Alright, how much we owe you?"

"Four knots for the sauce."

Glenn fiddles around in his pocket and brings out five golden coins, each with a pattern of a wood knot engraved on it. "Here's five. I owe you, old man."

"Bull-shit ya do! Drop your four and get yer ass out of ere fore I kick it sideways!"

Glenn sheepishly pockets the fifth coin and ends up following you out of the saloon.

"Well, I guess there's only one thing to do" sighs the bunny.
11212122.title: Misfortune telling

choices: Might as well ask Plazo while we're here
112121222.content:
"We have to storm the place!"

"You have lost it. You have any idea how many bunnies they captured last year alone?"

"That's the point! I want some revenge on Impmon, and I plan to get it. You said your brother is still in there, right?"

Glenn's shoulders slump back. "Yeah."

"Well, let's get him out of there! Let's get everyone out of there! Let's take the whole damn mansion over!" You might as well be jumping up and down at this point.

"You might as well try to freeze the ocean over."

"What's the population of Alcrux?"

"Nine thousand something."

"And how many ticklers are in that mansion?"

"Under a thousand."

"Then what's the problem!" Your logic is flawless. It feels perfect. It is perfect.

"First of all, we would be up against a thousand of the most ruthless creatures on the planet. They would be on their own turf, and we really have no idea how they're armed for combat. In fact, we don't know much about the mansion itself."

"If we train and arm the town, we can take them!"

Glenn is quickly becoming agitated. "Second, there are probably only two thousand in this town who would be fit for battle."

"That's plenty!"

"We would be lucky if we could get a couple hundred to fight."

"Why?"

"Well, these are ticklers we're talking about."

"Point being?"

"They're afraid of being tickled! I mean, I like it more than most, but you saw me in there. I nearly shot your head off just because you mentioned tickling me."

"Then we'll just have to teach them to love it before we storm the place!"

"Love it? Most of them can't stand it."

"Then we'll teach them to stand it!"

"Go ask the chief if you don't believe me." Glenn is obviously defeated by your unrelenting optimism.
112121222.title: Storm the Mansion!

112122.content:
"I've never seen anything like this before!"

"Wanna have a look around before we see Plazo?"

"If you don't mind."

"I just have to pick up some ammo later. Till then, lead the way."

You take off down the street, past several rabbits who stop talking to look at you. You don't let it bother you, however. One shop in particular makes you stop dead in your tracks: The Tickle Bar.

"Yeah, that place was opened up only a few years ago. It's not bad."
112122.title: Exploring

choices: Wait for them to finish and take a turn
Come back later. They look like they might take their time.
1121222.content:
Rubbernecking your way through the crowd, you come to an incredible sight. Ahead of you by about twenty feet is a brown hare in footstocks. And his feet are enormous! Although he is about three feet sitting (if you don't count the ears) each floppy, furry paw stands about two feet high. It takes you a moment to remember where you have seen that kind of bunny before: Monster Rancher (although it definitely isn't the same hare.) He is cursing under his breath, generally ignored by the crowd.

"What is that!" You point childishly to the restrained rabbit.

"A pickpocket. You can tell by the pouch hanging around his neck" replies Glenn matter-of-factly.

"Well, what's he doing in the stocks?"

"Being punished."

"What, by just leaving him there?"

"Well, the community usually helps out." Just on queue, a pair of little grey bunnies run up and tickle his heels vigorously. The restrained hare grimaces and kicks violently, although there is not much room to do so. He manages to kick one bunny in the nose, however. The bunny recovers with tears in his eyes and tickles back mercilously.
1121222.title: For once, It really is torture

choices: You go to the store with the sign that says 'Tickle equiptment'
You go see if there is more tickling things to do
11212221.content:
After the two bunnies finished, You went to take your turn. You noticed a glowing in your hand, then a feather appeared. The bunny eyed the feather and begged you not to use it.

But, you brushed it over the bunnies feet and he giggles a bit. Then you try and decide where to tickle next. You pick the stomach.

His eyes widen. You start tickling his stomach, then he starts laughing like crazy. Your turn was over, and you leave,
11212221.title: Your turn.

choices: You see it's full of furries
You see it's full of dragons
112122212.content: You decide to go back to the tickle parlor.
112122212.title: You go see if there is more tickling things to do

1121222121.content: You go over there and see the bar. On the bar are restraints. You wonder why. Then someone pushes you down onto the bar and puts you into the restraints.
1121222121.title: You see it's now full of bunnies

choices: You decide to give up and let them tickle you
You break free and *gasp* tickle them
11212221212.content:
Finally a few bunnies come along and point at you. They start laughing and come over. "Are you ticklish?" one asks.
"NO!" you reply.
"Well I guess you wouldn't mind if I did this!" They all started tickling you. "You're a little liar!" one says. "You need to be punished. They tickle you like crazy. They stop and one tickles your sides. This is so ticklish. "I see you're most ticklish on your sides, huh?" They tickle you more on your sides. They keep adding pressure. It tickles sooo much!
11212221212.title: You sit there and wait

choices: Play stupid and do like you don't get what they mean.
12.content:
You looks at the Gargomon and thinks a bit. Your Eyes looks around, searching and then you suddenly touched your head and like lightspeed appears the pictures again, from the inside of the Mansion, the tortures inside, the met, the escape and the met of this blue beings, this oxys.

"Yes....I think so" you repeated. You recognized the name of this big bunny. "Are we in your village now Glenn?" He nods and smiles. "Exactly." He helps you up and you looks around as you both got out and stand in the middle of a big field, bunnies jumps around, happily. Glenn smiles. "Welcome in my village, Alcrux, the town of bunnies and everything else with long ears like mine..."

He smiles, like you did but two bigger bunnies, black and with spears appear. "You two! What you do here?" Glenn was confused as the bunnies looks at you now. "You are entered the village without permission. You are arrested and come with us or we need to force you to."
12.title: Nice Welcome

choices: You end up in a restrain in public during Glenn get lead away.
You and Glenn get lead together to the torture-area.
122.content:
As you listened to the command of that guards, you huffed. "I not go anywhere! I not did anything wrong that I know. I not seen a sign telling Private Area - Do not enter " The guards growls and Glenn smiled, sweatdrop mainly. "Hey, don't take him serious....." You watch around. "You need to take me down to let me move!" Glenn yelled, tried to cover your mouth but it was too late, the guards growled. "FINE!" And with that they attacked you and Glenn and it took not very long, especially they were armed and strong before you lay below their long paws on the ground, arms tied on the back, like your legs. Glenn only got cuffed with his hands behind his back and you got slammed on Glenns shoulder as he got poked by the spear. "Get walking!"

Glenn followed and you huffs and see only the guard behind Glenn. Where you going to? What happens now?
122.title: Not move an inch.

1221.content: The guars restrain you to a pole that's alot taller than you your hands are cuffed above your head and your ankles are strapped to the pole, the guard then move Glenn somewhere else as someone else aproaches
1221.title: You end up in a restrain in public during Glenn...

choices: They lead you to a house, the elder house
123.content:
You felt this weird feeling in your stomach, like something got wrong, pretty wrong. "I'm sorry but why should we follow you? I thought, you Glenn here...." The Guards bunnys nods and Glenn smiles but he lost the smile as they went on. "We know him pretty well. But it is an order of the elder that nobody enter or leave the village....." "Wh...." You tried to speak as a spear pokes at your throat. "Don't complain or we need to restrain you both and bring you directly to the prison."

Glenn nods and bumps you, showing he want to follow silently to them now. You nods and went after them, one lead and one behind, spear lowered behind your back and you lined up behind Glenn.

But were the heck you are going?
123.title: Village-Restriction

choices: That is not important. More important is to know, is, why we got lead here?
he has no name but rescued me. I owe him much, maybe even my life.....
1231.content:
The guards lead you to the elders house, a half-circle like longhouse around the middle of the central place with pillories and foot-stocks, empty that far even guards leading other people to them, place them in and lock them in the pillories. They looks like merchants, this Renamon and a Bearmon which got locked in and it let you runs cold shivers down your back as you see them there stand silently and you passed them, toward the house of the elder.

It was clean it it and even the guards brushed they feet off in a kind of bowl of brushes and soap was there too. "Before you enter, wash your paws, you too Glenn even I think, you know it already." You looks at Glenn. "Why should we do that? Is the elder someone special?" Glenn shook the head. "No, but the ground this house is build on is holy ground. Not pretty high holy bit that worthy that you should wash your feet symbolic out of respect." You nows and brush your toes and flat blue soles and then followed inside.

The guards lead over to a room with a big rabbit with long, grey ears as Glenn bows and frowns at you a bit but then you reacts. "It's you Glenn? And who is your friend?" Glenn smiles a bit and looks at you and said....
1231.title: The elder's house

choices: You ask for the ease, whatever it is. If it helps
You do nothing and wait at the real punishment
1232.content:
The two guards lead you to a kind of house with steel-rods around and only a small bridge leads to an entrance. It looked like a Prison........prison? One sec, haven't they said they lead them to the elder or something if they follow? Why the heck are they got lead here, even Glenn. But you only felt the spear in your back as you slow your pace down and heard the guard huffing. "Keep going!"

You was afraid as you got lead through a hallway and it was scary, that there seemed to be no cells. It was giantic room and a big group of poles and restrains are there. Glenn shivered too, frowns. "THat isn't the prison! It is......" The guard huffs. "THat is the new prison. The old one got destroyed by a storm. And this one is more useful...." The first guard grabbed Glenn and put him to a pole and tied him up, with his arms upwards as you got grabbed at your neck and suddenly, got twisted around and hanging upside down during The other guard seemed to open a stock, hanging at a chain and place your blue feet in, closed by a padlock and they laughed now. "You both have will get the punishment soon....." The guards went to the door and lock it, getting their armor off and put their spears away. "But you, blue one, can earn a little ease....." They watched eachother, giggled.

You was confused what they meant and the fear of the punishment froze your blood.
1232.title: No restrain again!

13.content:
"Who the hell are you?" you asked climbing to your feet suddenly but when your head started to throb again you sit back down.

"my name is Gargomon." he says.
"You can trust me Are you okay?"

He bends down and looks at your face.
You start to feel uneasy but you don't know why.
"Where am I?'" you asked.

Gargomon smiles.
"You are in Alcrux." he says simply.
"A town populated by bunnies. it's really quite charming."
13.title: waking up

132.content:
Without really thinking about it; your still groggy from your sleep, you reach out and poke his side. It just feels like something that needs doing, to you at least. 'Haha-hey!' He sais, nimbly leaping out of arm's reach. "Cut that out, you know I hate being tickled!"
         "Uh, no, I don't. I don't have a clue who you are, or how I got here. Can you tell me more?" Glenn's face sags at this. "Y-you mean you don't remeber anything? Bing's Tickle Mansion, you freeing me, our escape attempt and recapture, our final busting out, and then our meeting the oxis and coming here?" You shake your head. "Oh-man.
That's not good. Here, I'll go get the village doctor in a few moments. I'll be back in a few minutes.' He turns to leave, and you notice something strapped to his belt. 'Hey, Glenn, what are those?" "What, these?", he pats one of the two holstered metallic objects fondly. "Automatic hand-crossbows. Built them myself. The times these babies have seen me to the other side of... Well, don't let anyone tell you there's a limit to how many rounds you can get off with clockwork. ...Or how frustrated you can be when you need to replace every little spring in the device." He grins, and walks out of the hut.
         He's barely gone though, when you sit up, and suddenly feel nausious.The room spins, it feels like you're on fire, and the floor jumps up and hits you in the head. Lying on the hard-packed dirt floor, aching all over, watching the ceiling twirl, you feel like your dying.
         The feeling passes as quickly as it came, though, and you stumble over to a basin of water set against the wall. Your jaw drops in shock. You used to be a human, then a blue and white veemon, but now you're a frickin' furry!
More specefically, a
132.title: You may feel some slight, random shape-shifting...

info.brief_description: You wake up in a town of ticklish bunnies after escaping Bing's Tickle mansion.
info.description:
You wake up in Alcrux, a town populated by bunnies, after escaping from Bing's Tickle mansion. The story itself continues from http://www2.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/1036613/action/view/chapter_map/12... . I thought it better to break this tangent off rather than to allow the extension to keep growing. I suggest anyone who wants to add to this story should read through the tangent of Bing's Tickle Mansion first.

Once again, cartoon cameos are encouraged.
